content.question: A uniform magnetic field of magnitude <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> is directed an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> from the <math alttext="positive y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></math>-axis. The magnetic field passes through a rectangle in the <math alttext="x z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mi>z</mi></mstyle></math>-plane, as shown. The angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> is slowly increased over time. Which of the following changes could result in the flux through the rectangle remaining constant over time, and provides correct justification?

choices.label: Decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> increases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the plane of the rectangle, while decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field decreases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the rectangle.

Decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rectangle, while decreasing the magnitude of the magnetic field decreases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

Increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> decreases the component of the magnetic field parallel to the plane of the rectangle, while increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

Increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> decreases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rectangle, while increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.

content.answer: Increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field. Increasing <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>θ</mi></mstyle></math> decreases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of the rectangle, while increasing the magnitude of the magnetic field increases the component of the magnetic field perpendicular to the rectangle.
